overview: Haggai urged the returned exiles to rebuild the temple they had neglected. His message: prioritize God's house, and He will bless. The book shows how small beginnings can have great endings.

verses.text: The latter glory of this house shall be greater than the former, says the LORD of hosts. And in this place I will give peace, declares the LORD of hosts.
Now, therefore, thus says the LORD of hosts: Consider your ways. You have sown much, and harvested little. You eat, but you never have enough; you drink, but you never have your fill.

passages.title: Consider Your Ways
passages.summary: The people say it's not time to rebuild, but God shows their priorities are backwardâ€”they have nice houses while His lies in ruins.

facts.text: Haggai's ministry lasted only about four months in 520 BC, but it motivated the people to complete the temple.
The rebuilt temple, though modest, would eventually be greatly expanded by Herod and become the temple Jesus visited.
Haggai is one of only two prophets (with Zechariah) whose ministry was successful in their lifetime, achieving their goal.

figures.name: Haggai
figures.description: A prophet whose focused, short ministry resulted in the temple's completion after 16 years of neglect.

figures.name: Zerubbabel
figures.description: The governor who led the temple rebuilding, encouraged by Haggai. He was in Jesus' genealogy.

videos.title: Haggai Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores Haggai's call to prioritize God's house.
